alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:47AM EST until December 19 at 5:42AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Connecticut... Farmington River At Unionville affecting Hartford County. For the Farmington River...including Unionville...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Farmington River at Unionville. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flooding is expected to spread across Meadow Road in the "Meadows" section of Farmington. Some low lying areas along Route 4 may also begin to experience flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 14.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.6 feet on 10/15/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon. this evening at 900 PM EST.
